alert.note: Alert for Mayes; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:59AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Rogers, western Mayes, northwestern Wagoner and southeastern Tulsa Counties through 430 AM CDT... At 359 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms 3 miles southeast of Foyil, near Tiawah and near Oneta. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Claremore... Wagoner... Bixby... Coweta... Catoosa... Verdigris... Chouteau... Inola... Foyil... Taiwah... Tiawah... Oneta... Mazie... Leonard... Bushyhead... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 236 and 268. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
